rules.name: Arxos Platform Architecture
rules.description: Core architectural principles and technology stack for the Arxos platform
rules: The Arxos platform is a comprehensive infrastructure platform for building information modeling with CAD-level precision
Core technology stack: Go (Chi framework) backend, Python (FastAPI) AI services, Tauri (Rust + WebView) desktop, HTML/HTMX/CSS/JS frontend
Database: PostgreSQL with PostGIS for spatial data, Redis for caching
SVGX Engine is the core SVG processing engine with CAD capabilities
Follow clean architecture principles with clear separation of concerns
Use Chi router framework for Go backend (not Gin)
Implement enterprise-grade security and compliance standards
Support real-time collaboration and cloud synchronization

rules.name: Development Standards
rules.description: Code quality and development best practices
rules: Follow SOLID principles and clean code architecture
Implement comprehensive unit, integration, and end-to-end testing
Use conventional commit message format
Require mandatory code review process for all changes
Maintain comprehensive API and code documentation
Follow language-specific coding standards (Go, Python, JavaScript, Rust)
Implement security-first development approach
Use semantic versioning and automated releases
Ensure accessibility compliance and performance optimization

rules.name: Project Structure
rules.description: File organization and directory structure rules
rules: Database code belongs in /arxos/infrastructure/database (not arx-backend)
SVGX engine documentation goes in correct directories for future development
Create files in correct directories within project structure
Avoid creating files at root level to prevent disorganization
Follow established import conventions: runtime files import from svgx_engine.runtime, test files import from top-level
Place documentation in appropriate subdirectories based on component
Use modular design with clear separation of concerns

rules.name: Technology Preferences
rules: Use HTML, HTMX, CSS, and vanilla JS for frontend (no React unless absolutely necessary)
Prefer Kubernetes on Azure for deployment and infrastructure
Use Chi router framework for Go backend
Implement Tauri for desktop applications (Rust + WebView)
Use Canvas 2D for precise vector graphics rendering
Implement Web Workers for background processing
Use PostgreSQL with PostGIS for spatial data
Avoid Flask unless there is a compelling reason

rules.name: Development Workflow
rules: Work methodically with no shortcuts or skipping issues
Execute tasks in order of priority
Build fully implemented features with no stubs
Work to completion on every single task
Follow excellent engineering practices: clean code, good documentation, strict compliance
Treat platform as development-only, defer production readiness until further notice
Review available context and ask for clarification before starting development tasks
Proceed step by step using best engineering practices

rules.name: Component Architecture
rules: ArxIDE: Professional desktop CAD IDE with Tauri, Canvas 2D, and native system access
Browser CAD: Web-based CAD interface with HTMX and Canvas 2D
SVGX Engine: Core SVG processing with CAD capabilities and precision calculations
GUS Agent: AI-powered assistance for design and compliance
CLI System: Command-line interface for automation and scripting
IoT Platform: Building automation and device management
CMMS Integration: Computerized maintenance management system
Design Marketplace: Component library and collaboration platform

rules.name: User Interface
rules: Default onboarding interface should be the Arxos agent
Provide option for traditional WIMP (Windows, Icons, Menus, Pointers) interface
Implement beautiful and modern UI with excellent UX practices
Use Canvas 2D for precise vector graphics rendering
Support real-time collaboration with conflict resolution
Implement responsive design for multiple screen sizes
Ensure accessibility compliance and keyboard navigation

rules.name: Integration Priorities
rules: Building information model creation is top priority (objects, symbols, system-specific logic)
Hardware integration and real-time data are secondary priorities
Implement markup tools for building information modeling
Support industry-standard data formats and protocols
Integrate with BIM tools (Revit, AutoCAD) and project management systems
Implement data validation and quality checks
Support enterprise system integration
